tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE rehabilitation_exercises (
    exercise_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    exercise_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    exercise_description TEXT,
    exercise_type ENUM('Stretching', 'Strength Training', 'Balance'),
    tutorial_link VARCHAR(500),
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE exercises (
    exercise_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    exercise_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    difficulty_level INT,
    target_area VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE progress_reports (
    report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    exercise_id INT REFERENCES exercises(exercise_id),
    date_completed DATE,
    duration_minutes INT,
    intensity_level INT,
    notes TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE progress_reports (
  report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  exercise_id INT,
  date_completed DATE,
  duration_min INT,
  notes TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE RehabExercises (
  exercise_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  exercise_name VARCHAR(255),
  difficulty_level INT,
  target_muscle_group VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE ProgressReports (
  report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  exercise_id INT,
  user_id INT,
  completion_date DATE,
  duration_in_minutes INT
)

CREATE TABLE Users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_name VARCHAR(255),
  date_of_birth DATE,
  rehabilitation_goal VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE ExerciseHistory (
  history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  exercise_id INT,
  completion_date DATE,
  performance_rating INT
)

CREATE TABLE progress_reports (
    report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    exercise_id UUID,
    date DATE,
    completion_status BOOLEAN,
    notes TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    email VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    age INT,
    gender VARCHAR(10)
);

CREATE TABLE sessions (
    session_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id SERIAL,
    therapist_id SERIAL,
    date_time TIMESTAMP,
    duration SMALLINT
);
